1.title: Grandparents and Other Strangers

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

1.plot: Henry Louis Gates, Jr. and his team use both DNA testing and detective work to uncover the history of a grandparent line and try to find missing relatives for actor Andy Samberg and author George R. R. Martin.

2.title: Mystery Men

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

2.plot: Actors Felicity Huffman and Michael K. Williams learn about the biological fathers they know little about.

3.title: Reporting on the Reporters

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

3.plot: Henry Louis Gates, Jr. and his team uncover the family stories of journalists Christiane Amanpour, Ann Curry and Lisa Ling.

4.title: Dreaming of a New Land

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

4.plot: Actress Marisa Tomei, business woman Sheryl Sandberg and actor Kal Penn learn about the challenge faced by their ancestors who immigrated from Italy, Russia and India to America.

5.title: Freedom Tales

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

5.plot:

6.title: Roots in Politics

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

6.plot:

7.title: No Laughing Matter

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

7.plot:

1.title: Harry Connick, Jr. and Branford Marsalis

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

1.plot: Actor and musician Harry Connick, Jr. and legendary jazz musician Branford Marsalis share their love of jazz and New Orleans itself, but they both also have European immigrant ancestors who blazed unconventional trails in America.

2.title: Cory Booker and John Lewis

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

2.plot: Two African-American politicians from different generations and opposite backgrounds, legendary civil rights leader John Lewis, and Democratic senator Cory Booker, learn about black and white slavery era ancestors they never knew about.

3.title: Barbara Walters and Geoffrey Canada

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

3.plot: Prof. Gates unearths missing links in the family histories of legendary broadcast journalist Barbara Walters, and equally notable activist and educator Geoffrey Canada, as they try to learn the original last names of their fathers.

4.title: Kevin Bacon and Kyra Sedgwick

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

4.plot: What do husband and wife Kevin Bacon and Kyra Sedgwick have in common? Other than being famous Hollywood actors in their own right, they both also come from old abolitionist families. But that's just the beginning.

5.title: Angela Buchdahl/Rick Warren/Yasir Qadhi

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

5.plot: Family roots of Baptist evangelical Christian megachurch founder, pastor Rick Warren, Angela Buchdahl, the first Asian-American Rabbi, and American Muslim scholar Yasir Qadhi unearth a story about the spiritual foundations of America.

6.title: Robert Downey, Jr. and Maggie Gyllenhaal

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

6.plot: Actors Robert Downey, Jr. and Maggie Gyllenhaal are textbook examples of Americans with a rich medley of European immigrant stories in their family trees.

7.title: Samuel L. Jackson, Condoleezza Rice and Ruth Simmons

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

7.plot: Actor Samuel L. Jackson, former Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice and Brown University president Ruth Simmons were all once second-class citizens in the Jim Crow south. Where in Africa do they come from and who are their white ancestors?

8.title: Sanjay Gupta/Margaret Cho/Martha Stewart

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

8.plot: Comedienne Margaret Cho, CNN's Chief Medical Correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta and TV personality Martha Stewart are all children of first or second-generation immigrants and share the peculiar burdens of that heritage.

9.title: John Legend/Wanda Sykes/Margarett Cooper

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

9.plot: Musician John Legend and comedienne Wanda Sykes, as well as Professor Gates himself and his 98-year-old friend Margarett Cooper, discover the extraordinary stories of the free black ancestors they never knew about.

10.title: Michelle Rodriguez/Adrian Grenier/Linda Chavez

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

10.plot: Actress Michelle Rodriguez, actor Adrian Grenier and Republican analyst Linda Chavez all share Spanish colonial roots, yet each views their own identity very differently.

1.title: In Search of Our Fathers: Stephen King, Gloria Reuben and Courtney B. Vance

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

1.plot: Henry Louis Gates explores the paternal ancestry of famous horror novelist Stephen King, actress Gloria Reuben and actor Courtney B. Vance. Shocking discoveries are made.

2.title: Born Champions

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

2.plot: The families of three of America's greatest athletes, former MLB star Derek Jeter, former world tennis champion Billie Jean King, and former WNBA star Rebecca Lobo, are explored by Henry Louis Gates.

3.title: Our American Storytellers

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

3.plot: Three iconic American storytellers, journalist Anderson Cooper, documentary filmmaker Ken Burns and playwright Anna Deavere Smith, learn about their southern ancestors' role in the Civil War, and in Burns' case, the Revolutionary War.

4.title: Roots of Freedom

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

4.plot: Actor Ben Affleck, NAACP president Ben Jealous and actress Khandi Alexander discover that their families' long established principles to fight for freedom and civil rights were passed down through generations of ancestors.

5.title: The Melting Pot

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

5.plot: Tom Colicchio of "Top Chef", Ming Tsai of "Simply Ming" and Aaron Sanchez of "Chopped", three celebrity chefs who cook the food of their ancestors, discover family members who have shaped their lives - and America's cuisine.

6.title: We Come from People

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

6.plot: Actress Angela Bassett, President Obama's political advisor Valerie Jarrett and hip-hop artist Nas discover that there is no singular narrative or preconception about the people who suffered through the era of slavery in America.

7.title: Our People, Our Traditions

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

7.plot: Playwright Tony Kushner, songwriter Carole King and lawyer Alan Dershowitz share not only a Jewish heritage but also a history of perseverance in the face of withering opposition, and as it turns out, so did their ancestors.

8.title: The British Are Coming

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

8.plot: The ancestry of actress Sally Field, New Age guru Deepak Chopra and British rock star Sting reveals the extraordinary global influence of the British Empire during the 18th and early 19th century.

9.title: Ancient Roots

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

9.plot: Henry Louis Gates Jr. explores the Greek ancestry of comedienne Tina Fey, comedian and radio host David Sedaris and journalist and TV host George Stephanopoulos.

10.title: Decoding Our Past Through DNA

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

10.plot: Deval Patrick, the first African American Governor of Massachusetts, and actress Jessica Alba learn incredible new facts about their rich heritage. Dr. Gates and some of his previous guests also unlock the secrets of their own DNA.

1.title: The Stories We Tell

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

1.plot: Dr. Gates explores the mysteries buried in the family stories of his guests, Democratic strategist Donna Brazile, actor and comedian Ty Burrell and artist Kara Walker, using both the records left behind and DNA.

2.title: The Irish Factor

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

2.plot: Explore the shared Irish ancestry of journalist and anchor Soledad O'Brien, Fox News host Bill O'Reilly and comedian, political commentator and TV host Bill Maher, and how they have been deeply influenced by their Irish roots.

3.title: In Search of Freedom

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

3.plot: How ancestors of comedienne Maya Rudolph, TV producer Shonda Rhimes and comedian Keenen Ivory Wayans struggled for freedom, and how each of these cultural trailblazers gain a new understanding of how they fit into this proud trajectory.

4.title: Tragedy + Time = Comedy

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

4.plot: Three of America's funniest men, talk show host Jimmy Kimmel, TV producer Norman Lear and comedian Bill Hader, uncover a history of tragedies and triumphs in their families and learn how comedy truly has its place in all aspects of life.

5.title: Visionaries

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

5.plot: Discover how the ancestors of business mogul Richard Branson and architects Maya Lin and Frank Gehry took audacious risks to create opportunities, and how their luck, ingenuity and chutzpah was passed on to these three visionaries.

6.title: War Stories

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

6.plot: Senator John McCain and Oscar winning actresses Julianne Moore and Patricia Arquette sit down with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. to look at the military service in their families.

7.title: Family Reunions

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

7.plot: Uncover family mysteries about two legends of hip hop, Sean Combs and LL Cool J, through the use of DNA technology that reveals information that shakes their very foundations.

8.title: The Pioneers

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

8.plot: Discover how comedian Neil Patrick Harris, feminist icon Gloria Steinem and author Sandra Cisneros are connected to pioneers who broke new ground and paved the way for their modern day descendants to continue shaping our culture.

9.title: The Long Way Home

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

9.plot: Discover how actress Julianna Marguiles, author Azar Nafisi and chef Lidia Bastianich are bound together by their ancestors' singular and deeply human desire to preserve their most cherished traditions.

10.title: Maps of the Stars

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

10.plot: Actor Dustin Hoffman and actress Mia Farrow, who last shared the screen together in 1969, also share a history of tragic deaths in their families that played major roles in the shaping of their parents.

1.title: The Impression

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

1.plot: Comedian Larry David and leftist U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders, whom David famously impersonated on Saturday Night Live (1975), learn about the horrors their ancestors faced. They also discover that they have more in common than they thought.

2.title: Unfamiliar Kin

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

2.plot: In an episode filled with incredible twists and turns, actor Christopher Walken, singer Carly Simon, and comedian Fred Armisen, each learn about a grandparent whose real identity and background had been a mystery to them.

3.title: Puritans and Pioneers

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

3.plot: Actors Ted Danson, his wife Mary Steenburgen, and William H. Macy, are three mainstays of modern-day Hollywood, who discover that their family legacies predate the United States, itself.

4.title: The Vanguard

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

4.plot: Three guests, journalist and author Ta-Nehisi Coates, film director Ava DuVernay and transgender activist Janet Mock, find their identities challenged. By placing their ancestors' lives in the context of history, they gain an appreciation for their family narratives and see how those narratives illustrate the diversity of the black experience.

5.title: Immigrant Nation

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

5.plot: Three guests, actress Scarlett Johansson, comedian Paul Rudd and actor John Turturro, explore the tremendous challenges faced by their immigrant forebears.

6.title: Black Like Me

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

6.plot: Three African-American guests, TV host Bryant Gumbel, producer Tonya Lewis-Lee and CNN journalist Suzanne Malveaux, delve deep into their family trees, discovering unexpected stories that challenge our assumptions about black history.

7.title: Children of the Revolution

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

7.plot: Three guests, actress Lupita Nyong'o, NBA star Carmelo Anthony and Republican strategist Ana Navarro, explore how their family trees were shaped by political turmoil and violence, discovering sometimes unexpected ancestry along the way.

8.title: Relatives We Never Knew We Had

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

8.plot: Actresses Téa Leoni and Gaby Hoffman, two guests whose lives have been shaped by family mysteries, are introduced to biological ancestors they never knew they had thanks to genetic detective work.

9.title: Southern Roots

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

9.plot: Musician Questlove, TV personality Dr. Phil and journalist Charlayne Hunter-Gault, three guests of disparate backgrounds, dig into their Southern roots, where slavery and its aftermath shaped families both black and white.

10.title: Funny Business

episode of.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (TV Series 2012– )

10.plot: Humorist Garrison Keillor (replaced by earlier Maya Rudolph story), comedienne Amy Schumer and comedian Aziz Ansari, who have found fame mining their family stories for comedy, learn about ancestors who overcame immense suffering.

imdb.plot outline: Harvard educator Henry Louis Gates Jr. hosts this enlightening PBS series that examines "the DNA of American culture" through an extensive discovery of the ancestors of today's celebrities. In each episode, a set of featured guests view their ancestral histories, learn connections, and discover secrets about their lineage, while sharing the emotional experience with viewers. Gates guides them as they see results and details derived from the background work competed by expert genealogical diagnosticians, who have analyzed genetic code and traced bloodlines that leads to documentation and the occasional confirmation or debunking of long-held beliefs. A variety of guests have included musicians, authors, chefs, and more. Actors who've made an appearance include Julianna Marguiles, Stephen King, Ben Affleck, Sally Field, Mia Farrow, Anderson Cooper, and many others.
imdb.title: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr.
akas: Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. (United States)
plot: Harvard educator Henry Louis Gates Jr. hosts this enlightening PBS series that examines "the DNA of American culture" through an extensive discovery of the ancestors of today's celebrities. In each episode, a set of featured guests view their ancestral histories, learn connections, and discover secrets about their lineage, while sharing the emotional experience with viewers. Gates guides them as they see results and details derived from the background work competed by expert genealogical diagnosticians, who have analyzed genetic code and traced bloodlines that leads to documentation and the occasional confirmation or debunking of long-held beliefs. A variety of guests have included musicians, authors, chefs, and more. Actors who've made an appearance include Julianna Marguiles, Stephen King, Ben Affleck, Sally Field, Mia Farrow, Anderson Cooper, and many others.::writermaia
synopsis: The diverse American experience as it relates to race, culture, and identity is the focus of Finding Your Roots. Presented by Harvard scholar Henry Louis Gates, Jr., this 10 episode series continues the quest begun in African American Lives 1 and 2 and Faces of America and carries it to an entirely new level. Each hour features a different pair of celebrity guests, who are bound together by an intimate, sometimes hidden, link whether it be as old friends, through long lost relatives, or a common past.
